intro: Morisonia grandiflora, commonly known as the largeflower morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. Morisonia grandiflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
